div.l: But god forbede þat we stynte here

A tale of me þat am a pore man A series of faded or erased, letter-like marks begins about 3 cm to the left of line 15 and continues beneath the current text for about 4 more cm; the total of 7 cm is approximately the length of that line of text. There are fewer but similar marks underneath line 17 (not in the margin). It is not possible to read any text from those marks.
I wol you telle as wel as eủere I can
A litul iape þat fil in oure citee
Oure ost aunswerde and seide I gruᵃaunnt to þe
Now telle on Roger loke þat it be good
For many a paste hast þou latyn blood
And many a Iacke of douere hast þou sold
Þat haþ ben twies hoot and twies cold
Of many pilgrym hast þou cristes curse
For of þi ꝑpersely yitt þei fare þe wers
Þat þei han eten with the stubbul goos
For in þi shoppe is many a flie loos
Now telle on gentil rogier be þi name
But yitt I pray þe be not wroþ for game
A man mai sai ful soþ in gāmme and plaie
Thou seist ful soþ ꝙquod Rogier bi my faye
But soþ plaie quade plaie as þe flēmmyng saith
And þerfore herry baillif bi þi faith
Be þou not wroþ or we departen here
Þough þat my tale be of an ostelere
But naþeles I wil nat tellen it yitt
But or wdede wewe ꝑparte I wis þou shalt be quytt
And þerwiþal he lough and made chere
And saide his tale as ye shal aftir here
A prentys whilom duelled in oure citee
And of a craft of vitailers was he
Gailard he was as goldfinche in þe shawe
Broun as bery a ꝓpropur short felawe
Wiþ lokkꝭes blake I kempt ful fetisly
Daunce he couthe so wel and Iolily
Þat he was clepud ꝑperkyn reueloᵘu
